storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view a dashboard of current scheduling conflicts to monitor and manage issues proactively

testCases.title: Verify dashboard displays active conflicts with details
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least 3 active scheduling conflicts exist in the system
User has permission to access conflict dashboard
Backend conflict database is populated with test data

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling conflict dashboard from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard page loads successfully and displays a list of all active conflicts with columns showing conflict ID, resource name, time slot, severity level, and conflict description

steps.action: Select a specific conflict from the displayed list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict information panel opens showing complete details including affected appointments, resources involved, conflict type, timestamp, and resolution options

steps.action: Compare the displayed conflict data with the backend conflict records by querying the database directly
steps.expectedResult: All displayed data (conflict ID, resource names, time slots, severity, status) matches exactly with the backend conflict database records

testCases.title: Test filtering and sorting functionality on dashboard
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Dashboard contains conflicts for multiple resources with varying priorities
At least 5 conflicts exist with different severity levels and dates
Filter and sort controls are visible on the dashboard

steps.action: Click on the resource filter dropdown and select a specific resource (e.g., 'Conference Room A')
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and displays only conflicts associated with the selected resource, hiding all other conflicts. Conflict count updates to reflect filtered results

steps.action: Click on the 'Priority' column header to sort conflicts by priority in descending order
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are reordered with highest priority conflicts appearing at the top, followed by medium and low priority conflicts in correct sequence

steps.action: Click the 'Clear Filters' button or reset icon to remove all applied filters and sorting
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard returns to default view showing the complete list of all active conflicts in original order without any filters applied

postconditions: Dashboard shows full unfiltered conflict list
Filter controls are reset to default state

testCases.title: Ensure dashboard refreshes data within 2 seconds
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Dashboard is open and displaying current conflicts
System has capability to create and resolve conflicts programmatically
Performance monitoring tools are available to measure refresh time

steps.action: Create a new scheduling conflict in the system through the scheduling interface or API while monitoring the dashboard with a timer
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard automatically refreshes and displays the newly created conflict within 2 seconds. The new conflict appears in the list with all relevant details populated correctly

steps.action: Resolve an existing conflict from the dashboard by selecting it and applying a resolution action, then monitor the dashboard refresh time
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates within 2 seconds and the resolved conflict is removed from the active conflicts list or moved to resolved status. Conflict count decreases accordingly

steps.action: Verify the timestamp of the last refresh and compare conflict data with real-time database queries
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays current timestamp showing recent refresh. All conflict data matches the current state in the database with no stale or outdated information visible

postconditions: System logs show successful refresh operations

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to suggest alternative scheduling options when conflicts occur to facilitate quick resolution

testCases.title: Validate generation of alternative scheduling options
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Multiple resources are available in the system
Alternative time slots exist for conflicting appointments
Scheduling interface is accessible and functional

steps.action: Create a scheduling conflict by attempting to book a resource that is already reserved for the same time slot
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and automatically generates a list of alternative options including at least 3 alternative time slots and 2 alternative available resources with similar characteristics

steps.action: Review the suggestions displayed in the UI, checking for clarity of presentation, time slot details, and resource information
steps.expectedResult: Suggestions are displayed in a clear, organized format showing each alternative with complete details: date, time, duration, resource name, resource type, and availability status. All information is accurate and easy to understand

steps.action: Select one of the suggested alternative time slots or resources and confirm the selection to update the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is successfully updated with the selected alternative. The new appointment is created without any conflicts. Confirmation message is displayed and the conflict is resolved

testCases.title: Test suggestion generation performance
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
System has sufficient resources and time slots for generating suggestions
Performance monitoring tools are configured
Multiple scheduling conflicts can be triggered simultaneously

steps.action: Trigger 5 scheduling conflicts simultaneously by attempting to book multiple overlapping appointments at the same time, while measuring response time with a timer
steps.expectedResult: System generates alternative suggestions for each of the 5 conflicts within 2 seconds per conflict. All suggestion sets are complete and displayed without delay

steps.action: Interact with the UI during suggestion generation by scrolling, clicking, and navigating between conflicts
steps.expectedResult: UI remains fully responsive throughout the suggestion generation process. No lag, freezing, or unresponsive elements are observed. User can interact with all dashboard elements smoothly

steps.action: Review system logs and error logs for the time period when suggestions were generated
steps.expectedResult: System logs show successful suggestion generation for all conflicts. No error messages, exceptions, timeouts, or failures are recorded. All API calls completed successfully

testCases.title: Ensure suggestions are conflict-free and valid
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
A scheduling conflict exists in the system
System has generated alternative suggestions
Resource availability data is current and accurate

steps.action: Review each suggested time slot and resource by cross-referencing with the current schedule and resource availability database
steps.expectedResult: All suggested time slots are genuinely available with no existing bookings. All suggested resources are available during the proposed time slots and meet the requirements. No conflicts exist with any suggestion

steps.action: Attempt to manually select a suggestion that has become unavailable (simulate by booking it through another session before selection)
steps.expectedResult: System detects that the suggestion is no longer valid and prevents the selection. An error message is displayed stating 'This option is no longer available. Please select another alternative or refresh suggestions'

steps.action: Select a valid, conflict-free suggestion from the list and confirm the booking
steps.expectedResult: Schedule updates successfully with the selected alternative. The appointment is created without any conflicts. System confirms the booking and displays success message. The resolved conflict is removed from the conflict list

postconditions: No conflicts exist in the updated schedule

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to generate historical reports on scheduling conflicts to analyze trends and improve scheduling practices

testCases.title: Verify generation of historical conflict reports with filters
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role and authorized permissions
Historical conflict data exists in the system database for at least 3 months
Multiple resources and conflict types are available in the system
Reporting module is accessible and functional
Browser supports PDF and Excel file downloads

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reporting module page loads successfully with report generation options displayed

steps.action: Select 'Historical Conflict Reports' from the report type dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Filter options for date range, resource, and conflict type are displayed

steps.action: Set the date range filter to last 30 days using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Start and end dates are populated correctly in the date range fields

steps.action: Select a specific resource from the resource filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected resource is displayed in the filter field

steps.action: Select a conflict type from the conflict type filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Selected conflict type is displayed in the filter field

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated and displayed on screen showing conflict data filtered by the selected parameters within 10 seconds

steps.action: Review the generated report data tables for conflict entries
steps.expectedResult: Data tables display only conflicts matching the selected date range, resource, and conflict type with accurate details including dates, resources, and conflict descriptions

steps.action: Review the visual trend charts in the report
steps.expectedResult: Charts accurately visualize conflict trends over the selected time period with proper labels, legends, and data points corresponding to the filtered data

steps.action: Click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and download prompt appears with filename containing report type and date

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens successfully and contains all report data, charts, and filters applied with proper formatting

steps.action: Return to the report page and click the 'Export to Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file is generated and download prompt appears with filename containing report type and date

steps.action: Open the downloaded Excel file
steps.expectedResult: Excel file opens successfully with data in structured columns, charts included, and all filtered conflict data present

postconditions: Report remains displayed on screen for further review
PDF and Excel files are saved in the downloads folder
Report generation is logged in system audit logs
No data is modified in the system

testCases.title: Test report generation performance
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role and authorized permissions
Large dataset of historical conflicts exists (minimum 10,000 conflict records)
System monitoring tools are available to track performance metrics
Reporting module is accessible and functional
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reporting module page loads successfully

steps.action: Select 'Historical Conflict Reports' from the report type dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Filter options are displayed

steps.action: Set the date range filter to cover the maximum available historical period (e.g., last 12 months) to include large dataset
steps.expectedResult: Date range is set to include all available historical data

steps.action: Leave resource and conflict type filters set to 'All' to maximize data volume
steps.expectedResult: All filters are configured to retrieve maximum dataset

steps.action: Open system monitoring tool to track CPU, memory usage, and response time
steps.expectedResult: Monitoring tool is active and displaying baseline system metrics

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report generation process initiates and loading indicator is displayed

steps.action: Monitor the report generation time until completion
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated and fully displayed within 10 seconds with complete data and charts

steps.action: Review system resource usage metrics during report generation
steps.expectedResult: CPU and memory usage remain within acceptable limits (below 80%), system remains stable and responsive to user interactions

steps.action: Verify the total number of conflict records displayed in the report summary
steps.expectedResult: Record count matches the expected number from the database query with no data truncation

steps.action: Scroll through all pages or sections of the report data
steps.expectedResult: All data is present, no missing records, no error messages, and pagination works correctly

steps.action: Verify all trend charts are rendered completely with all data points
steps.expectedResult: Charts display all data points accurately without truncation or rendering errors

steps.action: Check system logs for any errors or warnings during report generation
steps.expectedResult: No errors or warnings are logged, report generation completed successfully

postconditions: Report with large dataset is successfully displayed
System performance metrics return to baseline levels
No data corruption or loss occurred
System remains stable and available for other operations
Performance metrics are logged for analysis

testCases.title: Ensure report access control
preconditions: Two user accounts are available: one with Scheduler role (authorized) and one without Scheduler role (unauthorized)
Historical conflict data exists in the system
Reporting module has role-based access control configured
Audit logging is enabled and functional
Both user accounts have valid credentials

steps.action: Log in to the system using unauthorized user credentials (non-Scheduler role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged in and main dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the reporting module URL directly or through navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with an appropriate error message such as 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view reports' and user is redirected to appropriate page

steps.action: Attempt to access the report generation API endpoint directly using the unauthorized user session (GET /reports/conflicts)
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log in to the system using authorized Scheduler user credentials
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler user is successfully logged in and main dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the reporting module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Reporting module page loads successfully with all report generation options accessible

steps.action: Select 'Historical Conflict Reports' and set basic filter parameters (date range: last 7 days)
steps.expectedResult: Filter options are displayed and parameters are set successfully

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: Report is generated successfully and displayed with conflict data, charts, and export options available

steps.action: Verify all report functionality is accessible including viewing data tables and charts
steps.expectedResult: All report features are functional and data is displayed correctly

steps.action: Export the report to PDF format
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and downloaded successfully

steps.action: Navigate to the system audit logs section
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs page is accessible and displays recent activity

steps.action: Search audit logs for report access events by both unauthorized and authorized users
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs show denied access attempt by unauthorized user with timestamp, user ID, and action attempted, and successful access by authorized Scheduler user with timestamp, user ID, and report generated

steps.action: Verify the audit log entries contain complete information including user identity, timestamp, action, and outcome
steps.expectedResult: All access events are recorded correctly with complete details and proper categorization of success/failure

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains blocked from accessing reports
Authorized Scheduler user retains full access to reporting functionality
All access attempts are properly logged in audit trail
System security controls are verified as functional
